review: I visited lhs during my pregnancy right from my 6th week. Dr. Parimalam who runs the centre primarily is an experienced gynaecologist. She takes personal care on the patients. She shares her personal contact number with her patients and can be approached anytime even via WhatsApp.Dr. Shivapriya who assists Dr. Parimalam is very polite, approachable and clears our tiny doubts patiently. Dr.leonard (Dr.Parimalam's husband) is the radiologist who handles the scans. He does all the scans in a very detailed manner. Even during peak hours he does not rush through the scan and makes it a point to explain each and everything to the patient clearly during the scan. Initially I had apprehensions that a male doctor is handling the scans. The staffs and the doctor respect our modesty and keep us in our comfort zone during the scans.Both the doctors seem to have practised extensively in London. They have carried all their rich experiences back to India.The place is very clean and well-kept and we dont get the sick feeling that we usually get at the other nursing homes. All facilities are available within the centre itself - medicals, a lab to collect blood samples, scan facility etc. They don't make you run around to other places for such things. They give high priority to emergency cases and handle them promptly. The cost of consultation and scans are reasonable.The other helper staff here are very polite and courteous. But they need to be more organised during peak hours like weekends. The main disadvantage is the lack of a proper appointment and tokenised system in maintaining the order of the patients. If someone from LHS reads the review, kindly consider implementing a token system. Including the waiting time, approximately it takes a max of 3 hours to finish a scan consultation  and a max of 1 hour for just consultation. But it was worth the wait time. We just need to be mentally prepared to wait and respect others time as well.There is also a provision to attend special pregnancy yoga classes within the centre. Master Ramadoss from shanthi school of yoga conducts the yoga classes in the mornings. I have seen all the staffs and doctors working continuously from the morning even till 3 pm without taking a lunch break during the 15  times that I have visited the centre. Initially we were skeptical if we should go to this clinic because it was termed as a fertility center. But, Overall i got a very pleasant and satisfactory experience at the centre which helped me enjoy my pregnancy more. Lately we can see the centre gaining more popularity and a lot of patients pouring in.

the most unprofessional clinic I have visited so far. 
my experience :
my appointment was for 10:30 AM today
I reached there at 10:25AM. After waiting for some half an hour one lady called my wife. It's only when I asked her that I have booked the appointment to see Dr. Panimalar and I was promised on practo that  Dr panimalar will see the case, then she told us that Dr. Panimalar will be coming in some time. After waiting for another one hour, i.e. at around 12 noon, we got the appointment with Dr. panimalar. She suggested to do ultrasound and asked my wife to drink water. After half an hour, my wife told me that she is feeling that her bladder is full and she can not hold it further. I requested the staff to make it a bit quick, to which they replied that within 5 mins they will call, but the y called only after 20 mins when my wife told that she can not hold it. The radiologist doctor was a nice person and did the things well. The doctor further suggested to do blood test and promised that the report they can verbally share by 7:30 PM over phone. 
I asked the ultrasound report, to which they said that you will have to come on Monday to receive the same.
Then I went to the reception  to pay the bill, after paying the bill I asked for receipt, to which they replied that bill you will get on monday. That was so unprofessional. I paid the amount for which I am asking the bill so that I can claim at my office. After I asked the reception that I need the bill now  as I have paid the amount, they asked to wait for another 10 mins for bill. By that time it was 2:00PM. Thus for an ultrasound and consultaion and more importantly the bill, we spent 3.5  hours there and paid Rs. 2400.
This is not the end of the sufferings, as they promised that they will tell the HCG report over phone by 7:30 PM, I called them, to which they said they have not got the report yet and I will get the same on Monday. They are unprofessional to the limit that they can not understand that I was so deadly waiting to hear the report and some good news. 
This was the time when I literally got irritated. Why should I visit a clinic, where the staff including the doctor are not professional enough to keep their promises.
Though I new that clinic is a bit costly still I visited the clinic thinking that I will be at a professional place as claimed by doctor in one of her reply to a Google review.
But I hardly found anyone professional and friendly there except the radiologist Dr Leonard I guess.

O
I reviewed your notes that I have elicited a detailed history almost for 45minutes for the initial workup of fertility treatments. Fertility problems need a lot of time and the patients have to be approached sensitively. Hence I spend a time and note the intricate details that is the reason why we have a high success rates compared to others. 

I noted your comments regarding the charging for the medicines more money than the MRP which is completely wrong. 
I would advise you to approach us with the details of how much you were charged and if we have charged more than the MRP, we are happy to refund the money back. You can see the MRP in the tablet packing itself.  We are not charging extra over the MRP.
